oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Jerry Wallace
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Jerry Wallace (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jerry Wallace; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Jerry Wallace and Rick Phillips -- (01:38) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Wallace -- (01:52) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (02:27) Women in Military commercial spot hosted by Phillips -- (02:53) Primrose Lane (Jerry Wallace) -- (05:08) Phillips asks Wallace about "Primrose Lane;" additionally, Phillips inquires about the musical journey Wallace chose -- (07:59) Shutters and Boards (Jerry Wallace) -- (10:50) Safe play habits commercial spot hosted by an unidentified duo -- (11:50) Guess Who (Jerry Wallace) -- (14:50) Army R.O.T.C. commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (15:28) In the Misty Moonlight (Jerry Wallace) -- (18:15) "In the Misty Moonlight" is discussed by Phillips and Wallace along with recording sessions -- (20:39) There She Goes (Jerry Wallace) -- (23:18) Phillips performs a Legal Affairs commercial spot -- (24:05) Pretend (Jerry Wallace) -- (27:06) If You Leave Me Tonight, I'll Cry (Jerry Wallace) -- (29:47) Phillips and Wallace describe how "If You Leave Me Tonight, I'll Cry" propelled Wallace's career, and Wallace says "To Get to You" is his most requested song -- (33:56) To Get to You (Jerry Wallace) -- (36:37) High blood pressure radio spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (37:38) Don't Give Up on Me (Jerry Wallace) -- (41:00) Phillips performs a Casemate Museum radio spot -- (41:43) Commin' Home to You (Jerry Wallace) -- (44:38) Phillips inquires about Wallace's appeal to women, and both discuss who Wallace patterns himself after -- (48:35) All I Want is You (Jerry Wallace) -- (50:56) United States saving bonds radio spot performed by Phillips -- (51:10) My Wife's House (Jerry Wallace) -- (54:12) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wallace, Jerry; Phillips, Rick;
